content.question: Each of the figures above shows two adjacent uniform magnetic fields of the same magnitude <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> , but the magnetic fields are in opposite in directions. In each figure, a square conducting loop moves perpendicular to the two magnetic fields at speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. In which figure is the current in the loop counterclockwise?

choices.label: None of the loops will have a counterclockwise current.
